author: Kris Gourlay
title: Northern Lights seen across Edinburgh and Lothians as skies light up in stunning display - Edinburgh Live
text: Residents across Edinburgh and the Lothians shared their pictures with Edinburgh Live, with dozens flocking to popular beauty spots such as Calton Hill to take advantage of the spectacle on a brisk evening A 'stunning' display of the Northern Lights was witnessed across the UK on Thursday night, with awestruck Edinburgh locals capturing images of the aurora above the city. The aurora borealis display was said to have been one of the clearest in the country so far this year after the Met Office had residents on red alert with conditions being perfect between 10pm and midnight. Residents across Edinburgh and the Lothians shared their pictures with Edinburgh Live, with dozens flocking to popular beauty spots such as Calton Hill to take advantage of the spectacle. READ MORE: West Lothian prisoner who preyed on children was assigned carers before he died READ MORE: Royal Edinburgh palace has 'dramatic past' revealed with gruesome murders and grand galas Strong red and green tones were seen in the skies above due to a rare 'solar storm' with the lights caused by activity on the surface of the sun - typically visible in the poles or surrounding areas. Advice from the Met Office warned the best conditions to view the lights are when the sky is dark and clear of any clouds. Cloud cover ultimately blocks the view of the light.
